alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 8:59PM CDT until April 20 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County. Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 23.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 12.4 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 23.4 Tue 7 pm CDT 22.4 18.4 14.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM CDT.
